cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles south-southwest of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, forecast to pass southeast of New England tonight and cross Nova Scotia late Saturday before moving toward Newfoundland and the Gulf of St. Lawrence
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Nova Scotia, Canada (near or over eastern Nova Scotia)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for southwestern Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Magdalen Islands, and parts of Newfoundland
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for eastern Nova Scotia; Tropical-Storm Warning for portions of Massachusetts and Maine and parts of Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern New England coast northward to Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, and Newfoundland
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Florida sites listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at PortMiami; winds remain light to moderate with occasional breezy conditions from distant circulation.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Residual high surf and rip currents along the southeast Florida coast earlier in the week are subsiding.
